definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
to build up public opinion/to create a fuss

sentences.english: But the consensus around the Gulf Coast is turning more apoplectic and apocalyptic.
sentences.chinese: 但在墨西哥湾海岸的舆论正变得越来越激烈和末世论。

sentences.english: The strong pressure of public opinion has caused her nervous breakdown.
sentences.chinese: 强大的舆论压力导致了她的精神崩溃。

sentences.english: In the end, the mammoth dam had an oversized impact on world opinion.
sentences.chinese: 最终，巨型水坝对世界舆论产生了非常大的影响。

sentences.english: News consensus supervision is an important form of mass supervision.
sentences.chinese: 新闻舆论监督是一种群众监督的重要形式。

sentences.english: Second, the contents of press superintend hold tightly with modern living.
sentences.chinese: 新闻舆论监督的内容与现代生活紧密相关。

sentences.english: You have the ability to think freely, unhampered by conventional attitudes or public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 思维自由活跃，不受常规和舆论的影响。

sentences.english: Why did Japanese public opinion support his visit to Japan?
sentences.chinese: 为何日本舆论罕见地一致支持李前总统访日等等。

sentences.english: Supervision by public opinion is associated with press freedom, an inner meaning of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 舆论监督是新闻自由的一种表现，是民主的应有之义。

sentences.english: And if the propagation mechanism of WeChat can guide the public opinion?
sentences.chinese: 微信的传播机制是否能够实现舆论引导工作？

sentences.english: We now have more public opinion exerting pressure on politics than ever before.
sentences.chinese: 现在对政治施加压力的公众舆论比以前增多了。

sentences.english: but at the same time it was really just a buildup in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 但是同时我觉得这只是制造舆论。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, it is well received in international public opinions.
sentences.chinese: 对此，国际舆论总体反映是积极的。

sentences.english: But the strain of publicity, anxiety had taken its toll.
sentences.chinese: 但是公众舆论压力和焦虑产生了损失。

sentences.english: But right now, the situation is changing. Weibo has conquered the dominant position in shaping public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 但现在，情况正在改变，微博成为新的舆论引导者。

sentences.english: Strengthening promulgation of laws; Creating with efforts a good public-opinion environment of copyright protection.
sentences.chinese: 加强版权普法，努力营造良好的版权保护舆论环境。

sentences.english: This article was on a Fenqing have launched an attack on public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 而这文章一出就遭到愤青们发起了一轮的舆论攻击。

definition: to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
where the wind and the waves are the fiercest/at the heart of the struggle
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
